definition[0]: a line of light shining from the sun, a lamp etc
example[0]: the beam of a powerful flashlight
definition[1]: a line of light, energy etc that you cannot see
definition[2]: a long heavy piece of wood or metal used in building houses, bridges etc
definition[5]: the widest part of a ship from side to side
example[3]: Sherman looked at his sons and beamed proudly.
definition[7]: to send a radio or television signal through the air, especially to somewhere very distant
example[6]: the first sports broadcast to be beamed across the Atlantic
definition[8]: to send out a line of light, heat, energy etc
example[7]: The sun beamed through the clouds.
